009package imagingbook.common.util.progress;
010
011/**
012 * A simple example for how to use {@link ProgressReporter} and
013 * {@link ProgressMonitor}.
014 *
015 */
016public class ProgressMonitorExample {
017        
018        public static void main(String[] args) {
019                SlowProcess process = new SlowProcess();
020                try (ProgressMonitor monitor = new MyProcessMonitor(process)) { // uses autoStart
021                        monitor.setWaitTime(200);       // monitor progress every 200 ms
022                        process.run();                          // the task to be monitored
023                }
024                System.out.println("done.");
025
026        }
027        
028        // --------------------------------------------------------------
029        
030        /**
031         * The task to be monitored (slow process).
032         */
033        static class SlowProcess implements ProgressReporter {
034                
035                int iter = 0;
036                int iterMax = 100;
037                
038                @Override
039                public double getProgress() {
040                        return (double) iter / iterMax;
041                }
042                
043                protected void run() {
044                        for (iter = 0; iter < iterMax; iter++) {
045                                try {
046                                        Thread.sleep(100);
047                                } catch (InterruptedException e) {}
048                        }
049                }
050        }
051
052        // --------------------------------------------------------------
053        
054        /**
055         * A simple progress monitor that only prints query results
056         * to the console.
057         */
058        static class MyProcessMonitor extends ProgressMonitor {
059                
060                public MyProcessMonitor(ProgressReporter target) {
061                        super(target);
062                }
063
064                @Override
065                public void handleProgress(double progress, long elapsedNanoTime) {
066                        System.out.format("progress = %.3f elapsed = %.2fs\n", progress, elapsedNanoTime / 1E9D);
067                }
068        }
069
070
071}
